lexUnit.name: stammer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak with sudden involuntary pauses and a tendency to repeat the initial letters of words.

sentence.text: ` It was Molassi , " Rodo stammered .
` Oh , no , of course not , " Sophie stammered .
` Well , of course , " Santerre stammered .
“ I did n't … you ca n't … you 're out of your mind with fever , ” she stammered wildly .
“ But — ” Caro stammered .
“ It 's … it 's you who 's being so unreasonable , ” she stammered .
` B-but w-what about you ? " stammered the Captain .
` N-n-no -- I-I mean , he was stuck ! " stammered Virginia , when she could answer .
` B-but what about the letters page ? " stammered Bash .
` A c-couple of p-pictures for the station head , " stammered the lost soul , wetting his pants .
` Ridiculous , " stammered Gesner .
Thessy , forced to put the scuba outfit down to shake Rickie 's hand , stammered that he did not mind what he was called , but Rickie had already forgotten his question .
She sent him a haunted look , stammered that she was going , and tried to sidle past him .
Edouard sat to one side , helplessly , while Louise bombarded Grégoire with questions , and Grégoire stammered increasingly brief replies .
I felt stunned by this affability , and stammered my thanks .
I stammered something about not understanding cricket , totally incredulous that anyone should suppose I did understand it , or that I should regard the English side as ` we " .
He stammered his thanks as the Western sprang to life on the screen and Sweetheart slipped from her seat in a waft of perfume .
` T-to g-get my n-navigation notes , " she stammered the words over her shoulder .
Adam stammered something about feeling rather whacked himself .
` A-actually , " she managed to stammer as haughtily as she could , ` I 'm not playing at all , but you wo n't believe me . "
I was stammering pointlessly .
` Up -- upstairs -- " she stammered rather incoherently .
But he stammered uneasily .
He seemed embarrassed and stammered for the first time in his English .
Elaine stammered , and Francis wailed the name again and again .
I stammered in French that I was very happy to see him and very grateful that he had made time to see me .
“ But — it 's — but- ” Carolyn stammered and stopped .
I stammered out my history , my eyes occasionally wandering to a winter view of rooftops , an opaque winter sky behind his head .
The boy , weeping and bleeding , recognized Zeinab as the lady they were coming to see and managed to stammer out the story of the attack on his father .
